metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6369 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient checks in the UDF subsystem in Firebird 2.5.x before 2.5.7 and3.0.x before 3.0.2 allow remote authenticated users to execute code byusing a 'system' entrypoint from fbudf.so.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firebird2.5-classic - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-classic-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-examples - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-server-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-super - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
firebird2.5-superclassic - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
libfbclient2 - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
libfbembed2.5 - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
libib-util - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firebird2.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2.26540.ds4-9ubuntu1.1').
